column2: UTAH PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When passing another vehicle:
column4: pass the vehicle as safely and as quickly as possible.
column6: honk your horn repeatedly to warn the other driver.
column8: there is no need to signal.
column10: you can exceed the posted speed limit.

column2: 2. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column6: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 3. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 4. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
column8: frequent rest stops.

column2: 5. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column8: are making a turn.

column2: 6. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column8: yellow; black

column2: 7. If you are found guilty of passing a stopped school bus with its red warning lights on:
column4: your driving privileges will be suspended for three months.
column6: you will receive two points on your drivers license.
column8: your driving license will be revoked.

column2: 8. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 9. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column10: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 10. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column6: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.
column8: signal your intentions ahead of time.

column2: 11. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: narrower and shorter

column2: 12. At a railroad crossing drivers:
column4: must stop at least 5 feet from the nearest rail.
column6: must stop at least 15 feet from the nearest rail when there are flashing lights.
column8:
should start across
immediately after a train passes.
column10: should check for a train that may be approaching and drive around a closed railroad gate.

column2: 13. High beam headlights should be used at night:
column8: when there are no oncoming vehicles.

column2: 14. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column8: pull to the curb and stop.
column10: slow down and keep moving in your lane.

column2: 15. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column8: red, green and yellow

column2: 16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 17. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 18. Drivers are required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
19. This road sign means:
column8: Playground warning

column2: 20. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 21. The most common cause of traffic crashes is:
column8: bad road conditions.

column2: 22. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
23. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: of a brake failure.
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 24. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column8: maximum speed

column2: 25. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
